text.__SUMMARY__: Kobayashi's bat (Eptesicus kobayashii) is a species of bat. An adult Kobayashi's bat has a body length of 6.0–6.3 cm, a tail length of 4.6–4.8 cm, and a wing length of 4.5–4.7 cm.  The species is found only on the Korean Peninsula; it has been suggested that it may be a local form of Eptesicus bottae, Botta's serotine.
text.References: Won, Byeong-o (원병오) (2004). 한국의 포유동물 (Hangugui poyudongmul, Mammals of Korea). Seoul: Dongbang Media. ISBN 978-89-8457-310-9.
